alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 28 at 1:56PM CDT until August 28 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Jo Daviess County in northwestern Illinois... Northwestern Carroll County in northwestern Illinois... East central Jackson County in east central Iowa... * Until 230 PM CDT. * At 156 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Mississippi Palisades State Park, or 13 miles west of Mount Carroll, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Hanover and Camp Far Horizons around 205 PM CDT. Massbach around 210 PM CDT. Elizabeth, Elizabeth Fairgrounds and Elmoville around 215 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Woodbine, Schapville and Stockton Airport. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
